story.text: NEW YORK, Jan 2 U.S. interest rate swap spreads were flat to slightly wider on Tuesday in thin trade as Treasuries posted narrow gains. Trading was quiet after a holiday weekend and during an abbreviated trading session in U.S. government securities recommended by the Securities and Financial Markets Association for the state funeral for former President Gerald Ford. Two-year swap spreads were steady at 35.50 basis points, while ten-year swap spreads widened to 47.75 basis points from 47.50 basis points on Friday before the holiday. Ten-year Treasury notes US10YT=RR were up 3/32 in price, yielding 4.69 percent, versus 4.72 percent on Friday.
story.title: us swaps - flat to slightly wider as treasuries firm
